website_summaries.verdict: Elegant and classy full-size Jameson acoustic guitar with thinline body.
pros: Full-sized right handed guitar is ideal for all level of players
Thinline body is more compact and has a cutaway to help provide a comfortable stance for playing
Punches above its weight class in terms of quality, sound, look, and feel
High gloss finish will stand up to time
Comes with gig bag, steel strings, and guitar picks
cons: Sounds much better once you upgrade strings

customer_reviews.title: Best guitar I've owned. I bought two.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I really wanted a Martin...just didn't want to spend $700 or more. I had been going to Guitar Center every couple weeks to play the Martin, and ended up coming to my senses...I bought my first one in blue and this one happened to be my second, for the office! It's a really great acoustic / electric guitar and I've been playing for 20 years. I recommend ordering good strings with the guitar- D' Addario Light strings are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Self

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my pink guitar
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner and wasn't willing to invest too much. However, having a pink guitar is important for me, and it's really hard to find one that is affordable and full-sized. This completely met my needs, and my guitarist friend said it's pretty good for a $100.
customer_reviews.author: IvyTomarra

customer_reviews.title: Decent guitar......  crappy service
customer_reviews.text: To be clear the guitar is great value for the $$. However I'm only giving 3 stars because the customer service and support is nearly non existent. Many emails and no response. Then when I do get a response it's vaguely on topic and questions me about whether or not I purchased a Jameson product. Very frustrating to deal with. Enjoy the guitar which I recommend for beginners or players that just want something to take on trips with no worrying about ruining your good instruments. The action is decent, maybe a touch high, and the intonation is close. Overall this is a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Redhand

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW
customer_reviews.text: Bought this guitar for my Grandson. The guitar played well right out of the box, just had to tune it. We will replace the strings. The blue color really stands out, and amplified it sounds pretty good. I've played since the 60's and this guitar is worth the 99 dollars I paid. Easy fingering... We have a Gibson SG, an Ibizan and a Rickenbacker. This guitar is almost as easy to play as they are. I've seen the poor reviews, and the good so I took a shot. I'm very happy with this purchase. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: larryk

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This guitar looked nice and had a decent sound, though not as full (acoustically) as you'd get with a dreadnaught or jumbo. Amplified it sounded fine. But it did not last. Within a few months the neck started bowing. I was able to adjust it for a while with the truss, but the neck continued to bow and eventually the neck started separating from the body. Within a year it was unplayable.
customer_reviews.author: Iriemon - Fully paid purchase price for all items reviewed.

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: My son was wanting to learn how to play the guitar, however I did not want to spend several hundreds of dollars for something he wanted to experiment with. I have played guitar myself (not a professional) and I am really impressed with the quality of this guitar. It looks great and sounds great. A wonderful entry level instrument that was almost right in tune out of the box. The strings that are on the guitar are quality and I like that this acoustic guitar can be plugged into an amp. I Highly recommend this guitar for any entry level or someone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T. White

customer_reviews.title: Damn She Is Purdy... Way Better In Person
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guitar, I am learning and I have loved having this beautiful piece of work as my first guitar. There has been some great practice sessions, some whiskey, and some good times, I am assuming many more good times to come. This is great for beginners but my brother has been playing for many years and he loves it, he said he couldn't believe I paid just under $100, this is a very well crafted instrument. Well Done! He totally did make fun of me for buying a pink guitar but I really don't care. Lol She is mine and she is real purdy!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa McMillin

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Sound
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing lefty guitar for the price point. I am a beginner and stumbled upon this lefty guitar while doing research on options that won’t break the bank. This guitar sounds warm and full and is plenty loud when playing acoustic without an amp. My husband, who is a seasoned musician of 20+ years, was also very impressed by the sound produced by this guitar, especially one under $100. The strings that originally came with the guitar might need to be replaced quickly - one of them snapped after 2 days’ of light strumming. I guess that’s to be expected of most stock strings, so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: J. Law

customer_reviews.title: Jameson Lefty
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy for the low price! It sounds nice and rich and full bodied (like a good beer tastes....) when strumming chords or playing arpeggio's. The only issue it has, (and this is not a big deal since the Jameson is a very low priced instrument) is it goes out of tune fairly easily, though I think it will stay in tune better as I get the new strings broke-in. Nice guitar though.
customer_reviews.author: tony simmons

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice guitar for the $$$.
customer_reviews.text: I'm just learning to play so I'm no expert on guitars, but this is a pretty damn good guitar in this beginner's opinion. My only gripe is the neck seems a bit narrow. I can't keep my fingers from hitting other strings when playing chords. Not sure if that's normal, but it seems a bit odd to me. The strings seem a bit close together for some odd reason. Other than that it's great. Looks amazing as well. Got the blue one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Starting to learn chords and how to play myself so wanted something simple, durable, and still great quality and this guitar is perfect. Highly recommend it. Sounds great and looks stunning in the high gloss finish! At first the action (strings above the frets) were just way way too high and took a lot of messing with it, new extra light strings, and a new bridge set to sand down to finally get it better. Wish that wasn't so much work to do and buying new parts right away, so took 2 stars away for that trouble. But in the end it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: First guitar - very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as my first guitar as I didn't want to spend too much money and have been playing it for several weeks now. It arrived in perfect condition and plays beautifully. I saw some other reviews mentioning that theirs doesn't stay in tune very well, but I check mine every time I play and it almost never requires any tuning. It's super cute, sounds good, and my father (an accomplished guitarist of around 30 years) is even impressed with the quality. I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsea Brockmeier

customer_reviews.title: A great item at a fantastic price point.
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise this was. My expectations were not high for this guitar at this price point. However when it arrived I was greatly pleased by the overall build quality and finish. I quickly swapped out the EQ that was installed and may replace the bridge and nut with something of higher quality. But, out of the box, it is a great item at a fantastic price point. Zero regrets. Go for one.
customer_reviews.author: wasnotwas

customer_reviews.title: I love this guitar
customer_reviews.text: I will never get another guitar that is not a thin body. I love this guitar. It is the perfect travel guitar. I adjusted the neck to make the strings closer to the frets, it was a simple task. I am absolutely pleased. It can be used with an amp and doesn't sound too bad. I put it through an effects pedal. You cannot use this to record. It doesn't provide enough power thru a pedal. For a beginner, I would put on light strings. It comes with medium strings. They are fine for me. Perfect for $100.
customer_reviews.author: RAYMOND J. SCHMOTZER

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Color, but not Blue
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. Bought for my adult son's birthday and he loves it. Took it out of box, tuned it and started to play. Sounds great. Includes soft case. The only thing I would note is the color said "Blue" and... when we took a picture of it outside it actually looked like the picture on Amazon. But... It's really more like teal. I took some pictures to try and show the difference to everyone. He loves it even more! The color is beautiful, just not what expected. All is great though. Just look at it!
customer_reviews.author: Kit M.

customer_reviews.title: My first guitar was painful, as in it hurt to play after a ...
customer_reviews.text: Beginner guitar player, so I'm not going to pretend that I know a ton but I can tell you what I learned while purchasing and why this was the right guitar for me. My first guitar was painful, as in it hurt to play after a short time, I had to press quite hard to make notes clear. That is not the case with this guitar, the play on it is wonderful and as a guy with big hands it was nice to finally be able to easily play crisp clear chords. It sounds wonderful and feels good to hold and play. As a beginner this guitar has been an excellent tool to begin learning this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Nohkturnal Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good Guitar for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure people who bought this Guitar were surprised when it arrived. I sure was. My Ovation was stolen right out of my car at a convivence store. I'm broke, I had $150.00 bucks in the cookie jar. I remembered a top 10 rating in guitar magazine for this Jamison and it was $130.00 bucks. I'm really impressed. Well built, Beautiful color { Blue ]. Tuned right up and sounds very nice, Best in lower register, but over all for the money. I'd recommend to beginners and advanced. Not my Ovation, but sure gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.... with better strings!
customer_reviews.text: being at school across the country I really missed my guitar, not wanting to spend the money on a temporary guitar I found this. the strings on it was the worse, I replaced with some elixir strings 80/20 and it kinda rocks. giving the cost, its definitely a great starter guitar and or a cheep backup, or beach guitar. the action is a little high but nothing crazy. better than some cheap yamaha or other entry level acoustics. just dont expect a Martin but maybe an older seagull.
customer_reviews.author: S. carreiro

customer_reviews.title: The playability on this guitar is really bad. Its very tight and playing chords clearly was ...
customer_reviews.text: The playability on this guitar is really bad. Its very tight and playing chords clearly was impossible without muting strings. Im not sure where all the goods reviews are come from concerning the play. Had to put it down and play my zager. I ordered the blue one and yes it is a pretty guitar but only if its sitting in the corner. I would not recommend this for especially beginners or if you have fat fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Time ashlin

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY! An affordable quality guitar for Lefties!
customer_reviews.text: Left-handed guitars always end up costing more because there are simply less buying choices available. I was skeptical about buying such an inexpensive model for my daughter when she needed a new acoustic-electric but all the positive reviews convinced me to give it a try. We got the black version and she loves it. She's impressed with the size, the sound and the overall look of this model. She has only had it for a few weeks so I can't speak for long term quality but I don't anticipate issues currently.
customer_reviews.author: Syyryn

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Its a great guitar, both as acoustic and amplified, its gorgeous, it arrived sooner than expected, the sound is lovely, the action is good, the neck is straight and for less than $100 I feel like I stole it. Also, its made in China. I was looking everywhere to see where its from, and my guess that they hide the origin, but there is a little sticker on it that says "Made in China". As much as I do try to buy made in the USA, I think its fair to judge a product on its merits. I got this guitar for my 9 year old, happy to keep my Guild for myself.
customer_reviews.author: RachelZ3

customer_reviews.title: Best guitar for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My husband hasn't shut up yet about this gift. He's loving the sound and the smaller body. It's been easier to play and exceptionally happy to have a guitar for a leftie. This is his 3rd guitar and the others were much more expensive coming from the guitar center. He says this one by far is his favorite. He now wants one in blue. Very pleased. Can't say enough about it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Trust the reviews -- it really is that good.  Best bang for the buck available.
customer_reviews.text: This is that "too good to be true" deal that you assume could never work out. The guitar plays really nice and has surprisingly decent tone. I bought this as a "if he breaks it it's ok because it was cheap" for my 2 year old son but find myself playing it more than my Gibson SG. It really is a great piece. The finishes aren't great, the frets have some hard edges at their ends, the strings should be swapped out for better ones, and it doesn't have the rich tone that you'd get from a 10x more expensive full body acoustic, but this is a sincerely enjoyable instrument to play.
customer_reviews.author: mjp2

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this guitar. Sounds like a 500.$ guitar to me but I'm not a professional player, so with that being said, I may be missing something. I tested out a really expensive guitar at a guitar shop and I was expecting to hear something from heaven with how expensive it was and I realized it didn't sound much better than this very inexpensive one. I really have appreciated this guitar and I am not disappointed with it at all and my ears enjoy the sounds it makes:). I have had for over 2 years and it is still making me happy with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2Shop

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice guitar for the price. Intonation, action and tone are excellent. I paid considerably more for a lesser instrument in the '80s. This was a gift for My oldest son, and I'm considering purchasing one for myself, despite the fact that I've got more than a few guitars already that aren't getting used much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good guitar
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner at 55 yrs old. I have a martin acoustic, but the bridhe came unglued...so after reading reviews bought this...at 1st in standard tuning the top 2low strings were vibrating on upper frets...but kearning a new song and tuning a half step down...it sounds very rich and full! Vibrations stopped as well. The low pick up once plugged in do not come through amp...but i also have a cheap set up.. but over all... with the slim line.. i am using it more than my other acoustic.
customer_reviews.author: randy bohaty

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Good Deal!
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered a red finish on this guitar! The finish was glossy and smooth! The structure of the guitar looks and feels solid. The top has X bracing inside (very good). A pick guard was installed. which had protective covering that can be easily removed. The tone of the Guitar is good for a thin body. I think the purchase price was a great value for this guitar! Con's The finish on the top had some rub marks from the packaging during shipment. These were easily removed with some fine rubbing compound, restoring factory lustre! A few of the fret ends were sharp, requiring some fine filing and sanding. Guitar to me was a great find!
customer_reviews.author: Elmer A.

customer_reviews.title: A great guitar that exceeded expectations!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try a full size thinline acoustic guitar to mess around with when I'm not strumming my Martin.. I must say,this guitar is damn fine for a hundred bucks! Quality construction and materials and finish that rivals guitars costing $300-$600...I'm not going waste time repeating the wonderful 'in depth' reviews that others have taken the time to post, though I encourage you to read them for details if you are considering a purchase... Those posts convinced me to try a Jameson,and I'm glad I did! FIVE STARS!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for the price
customer_reviews.text: My first guitar, beautiful sound, strings were pretty nice. Needs tuning pretty often but easily fixed by tightening the screws on the tuning pegs. Came with 5 picks of various sizes, an "OK" case, and a couple manuals. Even though I bought mine "used" it came almost like new at a fraction of the price. 5/5 fantastic
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar at a Reasonable Price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but felt I had to in this case. This guitar is very well crafted, is very attractive with a smooth finish free of flaws (I purchased the blue finish), and has a great sound, both with and without an amp. It arrived on time and in perfect condition. I have been playing it for several months now and it holds tune wonderfully. I have rarely had to make minor tuning adjustments. I highly recommend Jameson guitars, they are a quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: David Chinn

customer_reviews.title: Great value for little money!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful guitar!! I also own another 'cheap' guitar, which cost about $60. That guitar LOOKS like a $60 guitar. This is a $99 guitar, but it looks like a $300-$400 guitar easily. The quality and craftsmanship simply can't be beat at this price, and the $12 protection plan for 3-years makes this altogether a wonderful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cici823

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: As a long time gutarist I can honestly say that this guitar is definitely worth purchasing. What an amazing value for the price. I have had several acoustic electric guitars in the past that were quite a bit more expensive, but over time I generally get to a point where I get rid of them, generally as gifts. This one is a keeper for sure. I would highly recommend this guitar to anyone interested in getting good quality at an unbelievable price point. Kudos to the Jamison Co.
customer_reviews.author: William  L Nelson Sr

customer_reviews.title: a lot of guitar for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've been building and playing acoustic guitars for years. My teenager began taking lessons. I didn't want to get into a large investment if she doesn't like it. The action is great and light for beginner, plays all frets without buzzing, tunes well, even has compensated bridge.It doesn't sound like a solid wood top but for the money its a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Desrosiers

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful guitar but...
customer_reviews.text: I've had the guitar two weeks now. It's a beautiful deep red color and I love it! I have only used it as an acoustic, not plugged in but great sound and when the strings buzz, it's pretty much due to my poor finger placement. I would say the one downfall is I pick it up every 2-3 days and each time, I have to tune it. I'm hoping once the strings finish stretching, the need to tune decreases. For now, my Snark stays attached. If it wasn't for that, the guitar would have received 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DenverGal

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this guitar for over 6 years. It was a great intro guitar. It still sounds great. Holds the tuning well after playing. I donated it to a retirement home for their activities department. If you take care of it, it will last. Sure it's not a Taylor or Martin but regardless, take care of it and it will last you a long time. A good guitar for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Tangman

customer_reviews.title: Eh, cheap is cheap
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this guitar reeks of cheap. From construction to the cheap plastic pick guard to the somewhat tinny sounds of the strings, cheap is cheap. BUT! that said; if you are looking for a beginner guitar for your kid or yourself and aren't sure if you or your kid are really serious about wanting to learn guitar for the long run, it's better to start out cheap then move up at a later date when you decide "hey, I like this playing guitar thing" than to spend big bucks and then have your expensive guitar collect dust.
customer_reviews.author: Fred J. Duffey

customer_reviews.title: My husband plays the guitar just for fun and he's pretty picky
customer_reviews.text: My husband plays the guitar just for fun and he's pretty picky. I bought this one for our son who wants to try his hand at it. My husband was impressed with the sound quality and thought it was especially a good deal for the money (about $100). My son loves playing on it. He's a small 11 year old and this guitar is just right for him. The base is not as wide as some other guitars I have seen, but it's full size and as far as I can tell a great starter guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Living the Dream

customer_reviews.title: Great value, needs a little set up time to lower action.
customer_reviews.text: Best $100 guitar I’ve seen, Grover clone tuners, binding on body and fretboard, Ok fret work for a inexpensive guitar. Action was high and to lower it properly required sanding the bottom of the bridge bone, nut was fine, and minor truss rod adjustment. The pickup is under the bridge bone and fit was not that good but with a little set up time, I was able to make it comfortable to play for my 13 year old son. Over all great value and perfect first beginner guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Albro

customer_reviews.title: An Acoutic Guitar with a flare for color
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this guitar, but some high points is that it comes in a few different hues, and I chose the blue. It also is light weight, much lighter in fact than my electric Donner dust guitar, which is an added benefit at times. Also you cannot beat the price for this great beginner to intermediate guitar. Also it comes with guitar picks a nice case and you can hook it up to an amplifier with the electric cord that also comes with this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Ok starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: Ok. It's a good starter guitar. It looks cool. It works so far. I haven't tried the pickups yet but my expectation is pretty low due to the poor finish and flat sound. I just now unboxed it. The first thing I noticed was the poor finish at the base of the fretboard, neck and head. Looks bad. Some spots had no paint. Might have gotten sanded off when they did the finish. Maybe I'm just picky because I make, build and finish electric guitars and I make sure i dont sand paint when i do the finish. Overall, It's as expected for the price and it looks cool. If your an experienced player, I would recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Meeds

customer_reviews.title: I love this guitar
customer_reviews.text: I love this guitar. I am some what of a beginner, learning to play. I have another guitar that is hard to play for a beginner like me. This guitar is setup easy to play right out of the box. It is a beautiful guitar, very sturdy. This seller shipped fast. The packaging of the item was great. What I like most was there is a card enclosed with the initials of the person doing a final inspection before the unit was shipped. I am very happy with this seller and the guitar. I highly recommend this guitar for a beginner on up.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Martinie

customer_reviews.title: Solid guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son. He’s a beginner So we didn’t want to drop big bills for a guitar although we still wanted something decent. After researching and reading the reviews, this guitar was the best fit. The boy is very happy, he said it’s easy on the fingers, stays in tune and the craftsmanship is solid. And it’s an electric acoustic. The bag that it comes with is very thin, if your travel with it you may want to get a padded bag or case. He hangs his on the wall. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Steak&Coffee

customer_reviews.title: *It's NOT broken!
customer_reviews.text: *I love everything about this guitar! It looks beautiful, fret true, sounds great, has a built-in pickup, and a cutaway. ...and I can barely hear, but I can FEEL how good it sounds! I've played it for a few people, and they said that it does sound great! This one's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Dave T.

customer_reviews.title: Lousy sound
customer_reviews.text: It couldhave been scrap pieces of wood nailed together. Really shoddy
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Krouch

customer_reviews.title: I waited over a month to try it out and ...
customer_reviews.text: I waited over a month to try it out and when I did, it would not hold tune. The neck was broken loose from the body and would not tighten up. Amazon would not honor my claim because I waited to long to report it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wathen

customer_reviews.title: $$$ wallet friendly
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth it! Bought this as a present for my boyfriend who has always wanted to learn to play. I wanted to get him something without spending too much money in case he loses interest. This was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Its a very good guitar. Maybe not the best for those who ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a very good guitar. Maybe not the best for those who are professionals. I'm personally a beginner and only play it as a hobby. It's vibrant sounding and can produce a lot of sound. The "blackness" of the guitar is very nice, it has a clear glossy coating as a finishing touch. very chic/classy looking. Yes, it comes with an amp chord and connects well with the sound system. For the price, its a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable - I'm in Love!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar because I was missing my old guitar (I left it in another country while I'm on a trip). My plan was to just use it and dump it whenever I was heading back, but honestly I've fallen in love with this nifty guitar! For the price range, you get a well functioning acoustic/electric with great sound quality (including when it's plugged in), a carry bag, aux cables, and the satisfaction that you didn't spend an arm and a leg for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaslynn Kenyatta

customer_reviews.title: Had to return the first one damage in mail but they sent the replacement before I could send the other back
customer_reviews.text: The second one arrive in fast time It sounds great the string play ok a little rust on strings will replace anway no buzz not hard to press down I am no expert but for my money this is a very good acoustic guitar the amp works fine I have a tuner it works fine I don't need one in the guitar for the price the case is fine I am extremely happy and this is four weeks later no buyer remorse. Thank you Jameson Guitar and amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice looking guitar but the action/set up is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar one and 1/2 years ago. It is a nice looking guitar but the action/set up is terrible. I was a new guitar player at the time so I didn't realize this for the first few months. I would get shooting pains up my fretting hand and arm when I played. I took it into a guitar repair shop but they said they couldn't fix the action for some reason. If they could, it would have cost about 1/3 of what I paid for the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Guitar
customer_reviews.text: My new Jameson Guitar is wonderful for the price! It is a beautiful blue I always wanted, and I appreciate the lightweight, thin body for my older fingers. The sound is good. The only drawback was not being able to use my guitar straps initially. I had to pay a local company extra money to install two matching end pins for guitar straps. But other than that, I use it for leading worship music at several local nursing homes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Its not perfect. Its a cheap guitar after all. The only problems i have are packaging, and fretwork. It wasnt damaged on arrival, but was packaged very poorly (again, cheap guitar) The frets higher than about 7 are pretty bad. Filed flat and never polished, so no bending up that high. I will polish them myself and have a crazy good guitar for the money!
customer_reviews.author: J.K.B.

customer_reviews.title: nice thin guitar, easy to have around, pretty thing, surfaces a little delicate, great for $$
customer_reviews.text: got used to this guitar after a couple/few attempts. good extra thin profile acoustic to have around. good for the $$. Some surfaces .i.e. pick guard are somewhat delicate wouldn't last with very young child. Nice companion to other guitars. Keep it on stand or in case. Hold chords clean or it will emphasize your inaccuracy with a buzz. Good to just have this guitar as another option. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: A.Lee Diamond Studio

customer_reviews.title: Thin body with a lot of sound
customer_reviews.text: I only did two things to make this guitar comfortable for myself. Changed the strings and sanded down the saddle. I wasn't worried about doing it, because the saddle is just a piece of plastic, easily replaced. I can see already where the first set of strings were making their own grooves into the saddle. Anyway, got the strings nice and low. Been slamming on the new strings and picking hard. Guitar sounds good and stays in tune. I am really surprised for only spending $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Apparently the reviews here are hit or miss, but trust me when I say do not under any circumstances buy this guitar. The pick guard was falling off, pickup wasn't giving any signal, scratches on the body, poorly packaged. Buzzing on the low e string. Good quality gig bag though, but that's probably the only good thing about it. Even though it looks promising for the price you'd be better off getting a used fender or Yamaha than this piece of scrap wood.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Schlegel

customer_reviews.title: He has never played guitar and had mentioned that he would like to learn
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband as a gift. He has never played guitar and had mentioned that he would like to learn. This is perfect for that. It's beautiful, and perfect for a beginner. It sounds great, and is a perfectly good guitar for the beginner or someone who wants to learn to play but doesn't necessarily want to spend a lot of money at the beginning of a new hobby.
customer_reviews.author: NurseErin85

customer_reviews.title: functions nice. a little punchy
customer_reviews.text: very well made! assembled in China. functions nice. a little punchy. I think its from the fret dividers. theyre a little rough and not very buffed. Very minor buzz, but all frets ring out nice and clear including those up high. nice paint and finish. I got blue for the blues. comes with good strings. bending is not where I like it. maybe I just need to wear them in. tuning heads are very nice and tight. no play. pickup is just ok. good for practice and skill honing. bag is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Allen

customer_reviews.title: Need a very very good inexpensive guitar? Yes?? Buy this one!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect guitar for the price!!!! It's hard to find a decent left handed guitar for this price but this one exceeded all expectations and overcame any doubts!!! Looks good, fingerboard feels good, tuning pegs feel strong, holds tune, slim body makes for great control while playing and Very Very Good(not great) sound and warm tones but for the price you can't beat it!!!!! Haven't tried plugging it into an amp(no need on my end). Carrying bag is a nice little bonus. Highly recommend for a practice guitar, jamming, or when sitting around a fire having some drinks with family and friends. If that is what you are looking for you won't regret buying this guitar!!!
customer_reviews.author: EAndrade

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy trying out new products
customer_reviews.text: I am a musician who plays multiple instruments...guitar for 14 years. I enjoy trying out new products. This guitar is fantastic. No problems with shipping at all. Sounds clean and crisp. I would suggest using silk and steel guitar strings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Don't think you can beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a beat around porch guitar. I have a Gretch hollow body electric, and 2 old Gibson acoustics, plus a 12 string. But now this is my go to instrument, I think it sounds great and fingers easy seems to be well made. I really like the thin body. Has a good pick up if you want to plug it into an amp also. I would recommend it to anyone .
customer_reviews.author: Isaac R Moats

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is just what I was looking for because regular full size acoustic guitars are too wide for me and the necks are too thick for my small fingers. This Jameson Thinline is nice and lightweight with a narrow body and quick action neck. I use it exclusively for its acoustic sound and not the electric (I use my Strat for anything electric). I only wish Jameson made a thinline acoustic 12 string as well. BTW, if you are looking for a hard case, the Road Runner RRMADN ABS Molded Acoustic Dreadnought Guitar Case fits this guitar like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D'Avolio & Nick Baldo

customer_reviews.title: Daughter is very happy, and the pricing is extremely reasonable
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas gift for my daughter, since she isn’t a baby anymore she unpacked it and checked if everything was good. I do not know much about guitars so I have to take her word. She is extremely happy and can’t wait for Christmas to come. All I can say is, it looks even better than on the picture
customer_reviews.author: Janette Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if you don't care for serial numbers on your products.
customer_reviews.text: I had this for a year before letting go of it to a friend. For the price, can't be beat. I did switch out the strings immediately to some D'Addario acoustic strings. I may end up buying this again.... but it bother's me it doesn't have a serial number for some reason lol.
customer_reviews.author: Electrikite

customer_reviews.title: it sounds very good. Not as good as a $800 guitar
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it sounds very good. Not as good as a $800 guitar, but didn't expect that. I'm just learning and it sounds just as good as another "beginner" guitar I got for almost twice as much. Works pretty good plugged into the amp too, though I usually just practice it without the amp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners guitar
customer_reviews.text: So, I have been playing guitar for years now. This guitar is great for new players and or if you want to take it outside or camping with you because its cheap. It isn't the best quality but you get what you pay for. This guitar does give you more then you pay for it, but its not a 500 or more dollar guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Mrclappyhanda

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to handle, soubds pretty good for the money. Great starter guitar or inexpensive instrument to use around the campfire.
customer_reviews.author: LJD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of my acoustic years ago and needed to do PT for a broken finger, so I hit Amazon for a new 6 string. Took a gamble on this one because the price was so low and got well more than I could have dreamed. Great craftsmanship, ready to tune and the electrics all work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Corley

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at the quality from the packaging to the entire ...
customer_reviews.text: I have played for many years and with many different guitars. Never owned a thin acoustic so added this in hopes it would play well. I usually play electric. I was amazed at the quality from the packaging to the entire guitar. I would say to the company making this product available.... Well done ! Great low action, quality tuning keys,. Stays in tune the works. I would have been excited to have one like this for 300 but what a great deal on Amazon ! Recommended just add to your collection or for a beginner. Easy to play. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: William Dymond

customer_reviews.title: Truely beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Truely a beuatiful guitar. Shipping was extremely fast (received the next day - free shipping and not a prime member). There was a pretty deep scratch on the pick guard but besides that it was in excellent condition. Definately needs tuning so if you don't already have a tuner, would invest in that as well but once tuned, it sounds beautiful. Very comfortable to hold as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aku

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This guitar was delivered as advertised... and met all my expectations. I am totally pleased with this purchase. There were some adjustments, mainly string height (lowered the bridge by sanding )truss rod and tune... the normal personalization steps you would expect and easily achieved. While I was making these adjustments I did change the strings to Martins just as a preference. The tone is great and just fun to play. I would definitely purchase from this company again.BTW the website has some useful info, can't say about customer service... haven't needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S.

customer_reviews.title: I got the Buzzing blues
customer_reviews.text: It sits in my fiance's music corner unplayable, 😥 something is wrong with the strings and one vibrates like buzzing bees. Really breaks my heart 💔 every time I see it. I spent a lot of time looking for what I'd hoped would be the best Xmas present I could afford for my wonderful man. And he loved it until it wouldn't stop buzzing from the one string touching where it shouldn't because of a imperfection in the manufacturing. It is a beautiful piece of wall art now I guess. It's very pretty and just like the pic. Just wish it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Mckinzee

customer_reviews.title: Basic Respectable Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Playable out of the Box, color is a coral pink hard on the eyes except at a distance, some missed spray on sound hole, good quality gig bag 20-30 range, Neck is bit narrow good for small hands, has a rich sound for 1-250 guitar range, No Serial Number would be hard to insur. Good enough for stage/ recording. For the whole pkg., for a acoustic/electric regardless of colour is a respectable affordable guitar, one could give as a gift or have as a spare to take to the park, stage, record with. Good for beginner, Immediate, even exper. on budget
customer_reviews.author: victorianhousewife

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Guitar!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my husband as a Christmas gift, and I was blown away by how beautiful it was when I opened it. The blue finish on the guitar is amazing, and it is very well made. It is of course a beginner's guitar, but for the price I was very satisfied. It also has great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Newlin

customer_reviews.title: NICE GUITAR,GREAT SOUND,UNBEATABLE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend been playing since he's 18 now in his 40's.He's had many guitars and just received this one.Soon as he opened it up he checked it out and made sure there was no defects of any kind,according to him there was nothing.He played for 5 hrs straight and can't believe the sound of this 99$ guitar.Also the gig bag,picks,and even a cable hook up for guitar.SO FIVE STARS FOR JAMESON CAUSE JAMESON ROCKS TO HELP YOU ROCK!RIGHT ON JAMESON!
customer_reviews.author: amy a.

customer_reviews.title: it is a BEAUTIFUL instrument and seems very well made
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews, I took a chance on this guitar for my daughter who's just learning to play. Let me tell you, it is a BEAUTIFUL instrument and seems very well made. Although we've not yet connected it to an amp, acoustic play is rich and lovely - not quite deep a standard acoustic guitar, but definitely performance worthy. My daughter LOVES it, so much she actually completes her list of daily chores without having a bad attitude and without being asked so she can earn "guitar time" each day. WIN! It came with a canvas gig bag, a couple of picks, a cord to connect to an amp, a cord chart and information from the company.
customer_reviews.author: MamaSingz

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY...
customer_reviews.text: It took me a minute to realize that I didn't have to reverse the strings on this guitar like I had to do when purchasing right handed guitars. This guitar is fantastic for anyone that is left-handed and it sounds so good. Thank you for the quality and craftsmanship you put into making this item and believe me, it is being used with the greatest respect....THANK YOU!!!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this guitar so I had something to travel around with and not have to worry about breaking it. Price was low so I did not have extremely high expectations. To my surprise, the guitar plays beautifully. When hooked in like an electric, the sound is not as good as a higher priced guitar, but that is to be expected. The guitar is thinner and slighter smaller than normal. So it would be good for a beginner or a smaller player in general. I highly recommend this guitar if you are looking for something inexpensive and durable. I play mine almost everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: Thanks .
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is a very good first guitar to learn on . I love this thing and it is my first . Yes it is not something that the pros play on but I am not a pro . But it is well worth the money if you can get one . Thanks again Charles !
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: not a good guitar
customer_reviews.text: Guitar looks fine, not easily playable as shipped, especially for beginner. action is too high will need set up before you can play. Intonation is pretty far off and will not stay tuned. I guess it is what I should have expected for $100. I don't know how it got so many good reviews, guess I got the junk one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We received it in a timely manner. The box was a little messed up, but the guitar itself was fine, other than it had a couple of small scratches, which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. It was beautiful! We bought the left handed guitar in blue. So far my daughter really loves it.
customer_reviews.author: cindgod31

customer_reviews.title: Not to shabby.
customer_reviews.text: I got this left handed guitar for my step son. It is a good value. The quality is pretty good as the frets dont have rough or sharp edges when sliding hand up and down neck. Thessds cutaway allows to reach the higher frets. Step son likes that it acoustic and electric. Sound s not to shabby for price.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Mauck jr

customer_reviews.title: Very nice guitar
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my daughter and took it to a guitar / music center to get it tuned and looked over before giving it to her. They said it's a very nice guitar. They hadn't heard of Jameson but assured us that it's well made. It feels solid and the color is as pictured (my daughter LOVED that it's pink). I can't figure out where the strap goes on one end tho, may have to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: BJNewFairfield

customer_reviews.title: Excellently Crafted Guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Blue Full Size Thinline Acoustic Electric guitar for our 16 year-old son who is a music enthusiast. He is thoroughly in love with it. It is exactly as described. It is, as the name and description suggests, thinner than your traditional acoustic guitar. As such, it sits more comfortably against the body when being played. It also can be utilized as an electric acoustic guitar because it can be plugged into an amp. Sound quality is excellent, both acoustically and electrically. The appearance of this guitar is nothing short of spectacular. Very pleasing to the eye.This guitar comes equipped with everything stated in the description. Excellent quality guitar for the money spent. Highly recommend...you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Great acoustic, poor electronics
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about this guitar right out of the box. There were a few scratches in the finish, and there were small drops of red paint that had gotten on the inlay. However, I quickly forgot about that once I strummed a few chords. The tone on this guitar is amazing! I thought the stock strings weren't bad, but I replaced them anyway (Ernie Ball Earthwood Light) and the sustain increased even more. The only thing keeping this from being a five-star review is the electronics. This guitar has a passive pick-up, so I need to crank my amp volume way up in order to hear it. Otherwise, I'm very happy with this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought is for a gift, read the reviews so that is why I choose this one. They were correct. I might even buy one for myself. I have a Taylor but this is a solid value for the beginner, good action etc. And if I go to the beach or just out and about, it would more than serve my purposes and I would not have to worry so much if something did happen??
customer_reviews.author: mbrown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use! Affordable! Sounds good!
customer_reviews.text: I want to relearn to play the guitar, all my other, older guitars are in need of repair. I bought this one to play until I can repair the others. It’s comfortable, easy to tune, and the sound is good. I wasn’t expecting much because of the price. I was pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Martens

customer_reviews.title: Good value, not without flaws
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner and a lefty I was struggling to find something that wouldn't break the bank. Been playing this guitar for about 6 months now. It still hold tuning really well. My only complaint is the sharpness of the fret edges. I found some videos online on how to lightly file them to make them smoother. Good value and fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: RockiesR0gue

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a guitar for a guitar class at school and since she was a beginner we didn't want to spend a lot. The quality of this guitar was fantastic and the sound is great. It will need some better strings eventually but for a starter guitar it was a great deal for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for literally anyone
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been very pleased with this guitar. To say that it’s a great for the price is true, but makes it sound as though it would not be as good if the price was higher, which is not true. I only have one slightly negative comment on the guitar, the dark blue color as advertised, at least for mine, is not portrayed perfectly. It has a slight green hue to make it a blue/green color.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: acoustic
customer_reviews.text: love this guitar, beautiful tone and feels good in your hands. nice color and great craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Spears

customer_reviews.title: Looks and sounds good
customer_reviews.text: I’m 54 years old and decided to teach myself how to play guitar. Received it yesterday, unpacked it and tuned it with an tuner app. Sounds good but I still ordered a new set of strings as per some of the reviews here. Will update with progress. So far so good. But I’m a beginner and don’t really know the difference between this and a high end instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Ekim164

customer_reviews.title: Solid guitar but bought used and has a hairline fracture in the neck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used so I was worried about buying, especially online. I knew there would be a few cosmetic issues. But there is a pretty scary hairline fracture in the neck. Still debating on returning it because I'm really worried its gonna snap. Uploading photos so I have proof it arrived this way. I really do love this guitar and spent forever finding the right one. Im just worried something may happen to it within a few weeks of playing it. Going to wait a few days before deciding what to do.
customer_reviews.author: drew hiles

customer_reviews.title: About my Blucille
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a great guitar. No flaws noted when I opened it. Plays well in electric or acoustic. The strings are okay but will be replaced soon. Only because that's my preference. I use a slide on it often, both in blues and as a lap guitar. It's a little light for the lap, but keeping that in mind practice accordingly. Salud
customer_reviews.author: abdulkhaliq

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Sounds Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am beginner, very new to what to look for in a guitar. When I saw this price on Amazon for this amazing looking guitar I figured that there must be a catch... When it arrived I was so happy, it was one of the most beautiful acoustics I have seen. I immediately showed it to my guitar teacher who helped me tune it and he was very impressed with this R.W. Jameson. He is even thinking about buying one now! This guitar sounds great and is perfect for a beginner as it comes with picks and a gig case. I am already learning a lot and getting my calluses, best purchased made on this site!
customer_reviews.author: liloved1

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: Been playing a really long time, and have many guitars. Of course my kid had to be a lefty, so I bought him this. Sounds great and is well constructed, I put on a new set of strings and it made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: ian cory

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work well
customer_reviews.text: A number of frets don't work. I've played guitar for 15 years. I needed a guitar to take camping and not worry about getting lost/stolen. This was not worth the money because a number of frets don't play properly. All strings on the 9th fret make a horrible buzz muffled sound, and the 6th strings 12 and 13th frets play the same tone.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny D.

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner, and having a full size Yamaha, that sounds beautiful... this guitar is alot more comfortable to play, sounds wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Wednesday

customer_reviews.title: Mine arrived just as hoped for .. so far so good.... Great!
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell, but sound is GREAT and seems well made! Great guitar for beginner IMO. I am a professional musician, but not a guitar player. I looked far and wide and this seemed like the best thing for the price ... the real deal. The one I got indeed seems to be.
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: it's a guitar
customer_reviews.text: I got this a Christmas present as my first guitar about 2 years ago and I have to say it is a guitar that is playable but the one I received had vary high action. as a beginner I had no idea how to fix that so I took it to the my guitar tech and he fixed it and now it is vary playable. the tuners are cheap but they stay in tune fairly well. so if you buy one of these guitars get the action fixed and put on some new strings and you should be ready to rock.
customer_reviews.author: Prairiemama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for left-handed beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great looking guitar & size. Not big and bulky. Very professional and sleek looking. Easy to tune, easy to change out strings if needed. Great value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Smith

product_meta.title: Jameson Guitars Full Size Thinline Acoustic Electric Guitar with Free Gig Bag Case & Picks Red Right Handed
product_meta.description: Style:Right Handed| Color:RedA customer favorite! Full size guitar that you can play acoustic or plugged in!. The tuning pegs are enclosed die cast tuning gears, usually only found on the more expensive models. A high gloss redburst finish tops off this guitar! THIS JAMESON ACOUSTIC ELECTRIC GUITAR IS ALSO AVAILABLE IN BLUE OR NATURAL FINISHES. Overall Length - 41" Body Thickness - 3" Scale Length - 25.5" Nut Width - 1.75" Fingerboard - Rosewood Body - Nato Top - Spurce Truss Rod - Yes Pickup - Yes Tuners - Diecast. A truly outstanding value - it has never been this affordable to own a guitar like this before! The thinline body makes it easy to play for adults or younger players.
feature_bullets: Play it acoustically or plugged in!. Spruce top
Includes a free gig bag case & picks
Diecast Tuners and Built In EQ
Full Scale Guitar with ThinLine Body. Please refer the User Manual before use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,977 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
